## Public Member Functions

### canIncreaseAlignment() {#afc1f63779a85d063c9a9e02fb87fa153}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::sandboxir::GlobalObject::canIncreaseAlignment () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns true if the alignment of the value can be unilaterally increased.

Note that for functions this is the alignment of the code, not the alignment of a function pointer.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00757">757</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="MaybeAlign llvm::sandboxir::GlobalObject::getAlign () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Returns the alignment of the given variable or function.

Note that for functions this is the alignment of the code, not the alignment of a function pointer.

### getSection() {#aa20526ec5783cdd6ecd1e43e7c8f85ce}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="StringRef llvm::sandboxir::GlobalObject::getSection () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Get the custom section of this global if it has one.

If this global does not have a custom section, this will be empty and the default object file section (.text, .data, etc) will be used.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00729">729</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>.

### hasSection() {#a8743f54dd4a19f956de512115d94d5c5}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::sandboxir::GlobalObject::hasSection () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if this global has a custom object file section.

This is more efficient than calling <a href="#aa20526ec5783cdd6ecd1e43e7c8f85ce">getSection()</a> and checking for an empty string.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00721">721</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setAlignment() {#a83748f9098fea276898c0741262a66e4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::sandboxir::GlobalObject::setAlignment (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/maybealign">MaybeAlign</a> Align)</>}>
Sets the alignment attribute of the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/globalobject">GlobalObject</a>.

This method will be deprecated as the alignment property should always be defined.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00709">709</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp/#l00264">264</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp">Constant.cpp</a>.

### setSection() {#af802ad5aa5721e72eeab21959b526c9d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::sandboxir::GlobalObject::setSection (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> S)</>}>
Change the section for this global.

Setting the section to the empty string tells LLVM to choose an appropriate default object file section.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00737">737</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp/#l00280">280</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/sandboxir/constant-cpp">Constant.cpp</a>.

## Protected Member Functions

### getOperandUseInternal() {#a212c05932ca0d1ac0e87b008542aeaa9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="Use llvm::sandboxir::GlobalObject::getOperandUseInternal (unsigned OpIdx, bool Verify) const"
  labels = {["inline", "protected", "virtual"]}>
\\Returns the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/use">Use</a> for the <code>OpIdx&#39;th</code> operand.

This is virtual to allow instructions to deviate from the LLVM IR operands, which is a requirement for sandboxir Instructions that consist of more than one LLVM <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sandboxir/instruction">Instruction</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h/#l00671">671</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/sandboxir/constant-h">Constant.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
